name: FASTA Credit for Checkout
author: RedBlade Software

sections.description:
South African Edition

The official FASTA Credit for Checkout Extension for WooCommerce.

FASTA Credit for Checkout gives the merchant the ability to have customers pay for their online purchases in under 5 minutes using FASTA Credit for Checkout.

The FASTA customer user interface is designed for simplicity, elegance and speed, giving your customers the ultimate cutting-edge experience under the banner of your merchant brand. It is fast, intuitive and secure for an inline experience that is geared to reducing your abandon rate.

FASTA provides a configurable sandbox making it easy to try it out and get started.

IMPORTANT: FASTA Credit for Checkout offers the merchant the ability to choose between an “Embedded (inline)” or “Redirect” customer experience.

FASTA “Embedded (inline)”, the recommended option. Your customer never leaves your site during the application process. It’s as if the process is designed as part of your site.

We recommend the FASTA inline experience to reduce your cart abandon rate by creating a seamless customer flow.
sections.installation:
Minimum Requirements

  • WordPress 4.5 or greater
  • PHP 5.6 or greater
  • WooCommerce 2.6 or greater

Automatic Installation

Automatic installation is the most hassle-free option as WordPress handles the file transfers itself and you don’t need to leave your web browser. To do an automatic install of, log in to your WordPress dashboard, navigate to the Plugins menu and click Add New.

In the search field type “FASTA Credit for Checkout” and click Search Plugins. Once you’ve found our plugin you can view details about it such as the point release, rating and description. Most importantly of course, you can install it by simply clicking “Install Now”.

Note that you need to need to click “Activate” the plugin before it you can use it.

Manual Installation

You can install plug-ins from zipped archives. In your WordPress admin panel follow ‘Plugins’ -> ‘Add New’ -> ‘Upload Plugin’ and choose the desired zipped file archive.
The WordPress codex contains instructions on how to do this here.

Note that you need to need to click “Activate” the plugin before it you can use it.

Configuration

Before you can start using the plugin you will need to sign up to FASTA Credit for Checkout to obtain a merchant ID. See the Sign Up section for details.
Once that is done, you can update the extension’s settings with your merchant ID and you’re ready to go.

Note: the extension comes with a sandbox mode which allows you test it before going live.

Sign Up

To register with FASTA head over to FASTA Credit for Checkout and submit a merchant query through the contact form.

Updating

Automatic updates should work without problems; as always though, ensure you backup your site just in case.

You can also manually update the plugin by downloading the desired version of it and following the “Manual Installation” section described above.
sections.faq:
How do I register with FASTA?

To register with FASTA head over to FASTA Credit for Checkout and submit a merchant query through the contact form and we’ll contact you with all the necessary details.

Where can I request new features or report bugs?

New feature requests and bugs reports can be made in the plugin forum.

Where can I get support or talk to other users?

If you get stuck, you can ask for help in the Plugin Forum.
sections.changelog:
= 1.0.1 – 2019-05-20
* Fix – iframe display inconsistencies
* Tweak – replace ES6 syntax with ES5.

= 1.0.3 – 2019-08-21
* Enhancement – improved order notes with links to the FASTA merchant portal
* Enhancement – added FASTA API keys to the plugins settings page, used to query FASTA APIs
* Enhancement – added loan amount confirmation when FASTA calls back to the plugin

= 1.0.4 – 2019-09-03
* Enhancement – allow for cart expiry: send cart expiry date to FASTA

= 1.0.5 – 2019-09-10
* Fix – do not attempt to add cart expiry property when hold stock for minutes is not set in WC options

= 1.0.6 – 2019-09-12
* Enhancement – add payment result handlers for better UI control

= 1.0.7 – 2019-09-26
* Fix – prevent sending FASTA script to client if not the selected payment method

= 1.0.8 – 2019-09-27
* Fix – change user-facing payment method name

= 1.0.9 – 2020-03-24
* Enhancement – update FASTA checkout page text and logo

= 1.0.10 – 2020-05-25
* Enhancement – update checkout page payment option title

= 1.0.11 – 2020-09-15
* Fix – prevent double encoding for checkout info & added the inline=true

short_description: Provide your customers the option to pay for their online purchases on your WooCommerce store using our instant credit product.
